item.title: Blogs
item.description: I have been trying to get into the habit of writing for a while now and after experimenting with the journalling for a while, I think it’s time for me to start sharing my thoughts over here, just so I can document my journey as it’s still just the start of it.

Queues, memory management and the ABA problem Pools A pool is similar to a Set with the following two distinctions: might not have a contains() method for testing membership allows duplicate elements Pools usually act as buffers in producer<>consumer systems.

item.title: AMPP
item.description: Notes from the book The Art of Multi Processor Programming.

item.title: 3 - Storage & Retrieval
item.description: Sorted String Tables (SSTables) Maintaining sorted order of data is simpler in memory, we can use any balanced tree (Red-Black, AVL etc.) which will allow us to insert the data in any order but read it back in a sorted order always.

item.title: 6 - Partitioning
item.description: shared-memory architecture share-disk architecture shared-nothing architecture — horizontal scaling or scaling out .

item.title: Go - Programming Language
item.description: Chapter 1 go has no notion of enclosing conditions in ( the built in function make can be used to create a new map The order of map iteration in go is random varying from program run to run The map is actually a reference to a data-structure created by make ReadFile returns a byte slice http.

item.title: Grimoire
item.description: Welcome to my Grimoire. I find programming and software engineering to be wizardy hence the name of my vault for notes is Grimoire.
